column4: Hi I have a problem here!the sound in Ubuntu stopped working!!!!solution??
type "alsamixer" and see if something is muted htere
no every thing is 50 %!!!!!something else???
and not muted? (there is a symbol below that graphs)
yes everythning is ok!!!i forgot to mantion that i am using external PCI soundcard!!!
: but the pc is reading the card corectly!!
with f6 you can choose the soundcard, is the correct one selected?
in alsamixer
: yes i check that too but nothing!!!it's weard because one day when i open the pc it wasind working,the on board sound is working!!
sounds strange, sorry dont know another solution
me too my friend,i consider to format or instaling gnome 3 to see if it is working!by the way in windows 7 the card is working perfect!
you are not using gnome at the moment?
i am asking because lubuntu is not using pulse-audio by default
not event installed,i am using alsamixer,the default by installing ubuntu
then you should also have pulseaudio when using normal ubuntu
i am not sure if "pavucontrol" is installed by default but its a nice app to manage volume for different soundcards, maybe have a look there
i give it a shot!w8 a second and i will tell you the result
sorry to tell this but the program you told me it's telling me that it's working perfectly the sound,i will install gnome and see if it works!!if not then format!!!
and what are you using at the moment when not gnome?
: unity! i give up on gnome becouse gnome 3 is not the style that i like,ubuntu 10.04 style is what i liked much!!!
for me unity and gnome3 is the same :)
:w8 i will logout and see if threre is change on sound
